title: Practice Challenge
description: Apply what you've learned in this interactive coding challenge.
instructions:
Create a simple shopping cart calculator:
1. Create an 'int' variable for quantity (number of items)
2. Create a 'double' variable for price per item
3. Calculate the total cost (quantity Ã— price) and store it in a new 'double' variable
4. Display all three values with labels

hints.text: Use the * operator for multiplication! quantity * pricePerItem will calculate the total. Store it in a double variable since it might have decimals.
Using a comma for decimals: double price = 19,99; is WRONG! Use a period: 19.99
Trying to store decimals in an int: int price = 19.99; will cause an error! Use double for decimals.
Forgetting quotes in Console.WriteLine labels: Console.WriteLine(Total: + total) is wrong. Use "Total: " with quotes!
